context_bundle.summary: Rust testing with unit tests, integration tests, property-based testing with proptest, and test organization

onboarding.quick_start: cargo test && cargo test --release && cargo test -- --nocapture
common_patterns: Unit test: '#[cfg(test)] mod tests { use super::*; #[test] fn it_works() { assert_eq!(2 + 2, 4); } }'
Test panic: '#[test] #[should_panic(expected = "divide by zero")] fn test_panic() { divide(1, 0); }'
Result in tests: '#[test] fn test_result() -> Result<(), String> { if 2 + 2 == 4 { Ok(()) } else { Err(String::from("failed")) } }'
Integration tests: 'tests/integration_test.rs with mod common; use mylib::function; #[test] fn test_integration() { /* ... */ }'
Test attributes: '#[test] #[ignore] fn expensive_test() { /* ... */ } // run with cargo test -- --ignored'
Proptest: 'use proptest::prelude::*; proptest! { #[test] fn test_property(x in 0..100i32) { assert!(x >= 0); } }'
Benchmarking: '#[bench] fn bench_function(b: &mut Bencher) { b.iter(|| function()); } // requires nightly'
Test helpers: 'fn setup() -> TestContext { /* ... */ } #[test] fn test_with_setup() { let ctx = setup(); /* ... */ }'
known_errors: test failed: Check assertion, add --nocapture to see println! output
test ignored: Remove #[ignore] or run with --ignored flag
integration test not found: Ensure tests/ directory at crate root
proptest shrinking: Examine minimal failing case, adjust strategy
test timeout: Increase timeout or optimize test, use --test-threads=1 for serial execution
benchmark unstable: Run multiple times, use criterion crate for stable benchmarks
